alert.note: Alert for Blount; Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:13PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Blount, southwestern Etowah and northeastern St. Clair Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 413 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oneonta, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Ashville, Steele, Altoona, Walnut Grove, Neely Henry Lake, Highland Lake, Whitney Junction, Alabama International Dragway, Gallant, Gadsden Municipal Airport, Horse Pens Forty, I 59 Rest Areas At Oneonta, Camp Sumatanga and Ramsey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and northeastern Alabama.
